name: Octavian Rotari
welcomeMessage: I’m an enthusiastic web developer recently moved to Edinburgh. I’m curently looking for job opportunitues and i want to meet other fellow coders.

courses.name: Makers Academy
courses.location: Makers Academy, Commercial Street, City of London, United Kingdom
courses.description: Makers Academy is Europe's leading Web Developer bootcamp. With our help, you'll learn the principles of software craftsmanship and we'll also help you get your first job. We've graduated over 700 students into their dream jobs as junior developers.

courses.name: Front-End Web Developer Nanodegree
courses.description: Master the skills required to become a Front-End Web Developer, and start building beautiful, responsive websites optimized for mobile and desktop performance. Learn the fundamentals of how the web works and gain a working knowledge of the three foundational languages that power each and every website: HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

projects.title: Accounting
projects.description: This is a web-app developed with Rails. It’s purpose is to help small-scale transport companies with their accounting. All expenses are registered (invoices, tickets etc) as well as vehicles and categories, then accountability calculations are performed and the owners can see an overview of expenditures and profits.

projects.title: Omnifood
projects.description: The emphasis of this project was to improve my web-designing skills, as my ultimate goal is to become a front-end developer. I undertook a course on web-design and as a final project in this course i had to create a website for superfulous client Omnifood. The focus of this web-site was to attract users to subscribe to a monthly food delivery contract.

projects.title: Portfolio (WIP)
projects.description: This was the first project after the course on responsiveness. In this course I followed the best practices of using media queries to arrange the content of the page on different screens, I also used Gulp to automate tasks as the image resolutions, minify javascript, compile sass in Css and minify Css too and I also use semantic HTML tags and srcset to set the appropriate image for every screen size and resolution.

projects.title: CMS PHP
projects.description: My final assessment in the php course was to build a fully functioning CMS (content management system). This project was constructed of two parts, a blog part which was accessible to all online users as a platform to access published blog posts and an admin part, whereby registered users could upload and modify blog posts with categories and contents.
